page.title: 03Changing Times N.W.Edinburgh
page.content: {Davidson's Mains}used to be a village on the outskirts of Edinburgh but now has been enclosed by the City's growth.{Mr Gideon Whiteford,}93, is one of its oldest residents and he told us about its past. Its nickname used to be{Muttonhole}as sheep were brought there for slaughter. At one time there were 5{dairies}in the village. The old {school}stood on the present school's site.Classes averaged 40 pupils. {Roads}were made of chippings from the local quarry packed down with earth. The village had its own{station}and {trains}ran regularly into the city. "Quality homes for quality people" was the slogan of{houses}built after 1900 giving Quality St.its name.{Buses}ran to and from the city. The{railway line closed in the 50's. The village now is a busy{shopping}and{residential}area.
